text: Harry Dean Stanton (July 14, 1926 - September 15, 2017)Harry Dean Stanton Biography (1926â€“) was an American actor, musician, and singer. He was known for his roles in Paris, Texas, Kelly's Heroes, Dillinger, Straight Time, Alien, Repo Man, Pretty in Pink, The Last Temptation of Christ, Wild at Heart, The Green Mile, The Pledge, Rango and Lucky. Stanton was a favorite of the late movie critic Roger Ebert who has said that "no movie featuring either Harry Dean Stanton or M. Emmet Walsh in a supporting role can be altogether bad." However, Ebert later admitted that Dream a Little Dream (1989), in which Stanton appeared, was a "clear violation" of this rule. For his role in Lucky, Stanton was posthumously awarded the Satellite Award in 2018 alongside Gary Oldman. Stanton was born on July 14, 1926 in West Irvine, Kentucky. He studied at the University of Kentucky.
